This issue is reserved for people who never contributed to Open Source before. We know that the process of creating a pull request is the biggest barrier for new contributors. This issue is for you ğŸ’

[About First Timers Only](http://www.firsttimersonly.com/).

### ğŸ¤” What you will need to know.

Nothing. This issue is meant to welcome you to Open Source :) We are happy to walk you through the process.

### ğŸ“‹ Step by Step

- [ ] ğŸ‘Œ **Join the team**: Add yourself to a Jekyll affinity team.

  Go to [teams.jekyllrb.com](https://teams.jekyllrb.com/) and join a team that best fits your interests. Once you click the link to join a team, you will soon receive an email inviting you to join the Jekyll organization.

- [ ] ğŸ™‹ **Claim this issue**: Comment below.

  Leave a comment that you have claimed this issue.

- [ ] ğŸ“ **Update** the file [$FILENAME]($BRANCH_URL) in the `$REPO` repository (press the little pen Icon) and edit the line as shown below.


```diff
$DIFF
```


- [ ] ğŸ’¾ **Commit** your changes

- [ ] ğŸ”€ **Start a Pull Request**. There are two ways how you can start a pull request:

  1. If you are familiar with the terminal or would like to learn it, [here is a great tutorial](https://egghead.io/series/how-to-contribute-to-an-open-source-project-on-github) on how to send a pull request using the terminal.

  2. You can [edit files directly in your browser](https://help.github.com/articles/editing-files-in-your-repository/)

- [ ] ğŸ **Done** Ask in comments for a review :)
